JSsvFS7ZweOFE8GjT-fagg.text: Finally I found this amazing French bakery very yummy and friendly staff. But I closes early around 5pm

photos.caption: Photo of La Gourmandine Bakery & Pastry Shop - Mt Lebanon, PA, United States. Red pepper and feta cheese quiche

y1WZWoHoHtlT6x2dkcb_Uw.text: Authentic French pastries and food! We were welcomed with immediate, fast and friendly service upon entering the shop. Everything was very reasonably priced, and meals include a drink option. Absolutely delicious food and pastries! I haven't found this quality food, especially pastries, in the US. The desserts easily rival what you would find in an upscale restaurant. We ate dessert at the shop, and took a second round home to share! Even though it's a two hour drive, I will certainly be returning.

UQutpRw_8dWs8UldCywl3Q.text: The quiche is the best I've ever had! I've only tried one of their pastries but I loved it. I can see this place becoming quite the habit!

R8pOX9aZ9goAloCjtUoYiQ.text: New location, same amazing breads, pastries and French yummies as the more well known place in Lawrenceville.  I love this place. There is usually a long line on weekends, but it is so worth the wait.  Baguettes, quiche, croissants, it's all delicious.

cuZEADXJtSuS-0p5l_maYA.text: Overall, excellent place. I lived in France for almost 10 years and I know my French bread and pastries. The brioche is good (not the best I've had but still solid), the pain au chocolat is also delicious. Pastries are slightly sweet but still 10 times better than the average american pastry. The only disappointment was the baguette - it was far better than what grocery stores call "baguettes" but still had a bland quality to it. I think if I had gotten their other baguette (it looked like what the French call "tradition") it would've probably been better. I will definitely come back when in the area!!

9KISq-6lbevsHAXFh8E4xA.text: I usually go to the Lawrenceville location but I was out in Mt Lebanon and wanted a quick breakfast with my son. The location is really cute. It's very similar to the other location, but had parking. The food was exactly the same. My almost 2-year old scarfed down almost a whole order of chocquettes and I had an almond croissant with a cup of tea. There were a few more tables than Lawrenceville, I think, and we were happy to be able to grab one and enjoy our breakfast. It's nice that there are two locations to visit with the same quality at each.

hRZfS8vXbIQSOAYbKVGmgQ.text: I don't need to say anything that hasn't already been covered in the other reviews.  This place is decadent.  If you want high quality, delicious pastries at great prices - this is the place to go.  It's awesome that this second location has opened in the south hills!  The only recommendation would be to add a few cafe tables outside.  Get there early to get first dibs on your favorite items before they sell out!

amHChBNcJS5bR0_oa2JhJA.text: Phenomenal pastries!  Their croissants are melt in your mouth buttery soft.  I especially love that they offer traditional French Christmas desserts.  Bring a box of their goodies to any occasion and your friends will love you!

cu9sW3pNgNtJPMR8IlvqaA.text: The best bakery in the south hills!  We buy bread and desserts here as much as possible. My personal favorite are their almond croissants!

QkslSReKjN2tmMBLvix29Q.text: Utterly.unbelievably.delicious. Seriously. The pistachio eclair....there are no words for it. :-) Yes, parking and space is at a premium and you may have to wait,  but the wait is well worth it.  Every pastry that we tried was unique and delicious!

kmMC9iXwflDqDtyySdTnEw.text: Wow... Great place... Finally a True French pastry shop in the south hills... For those who want to complain about a wait and wanting to go GE to get there "baguette" please continue to do so it only means not for those of us who appreciate True craftsmanship...

rK5FrKg7oSOZptWg46lUTw.text: Absolutely amazing. How they are able to make such amazing bread with less than stellar Pittsburgh water is a mystery. The desserts are to die for. I went with the prosciutto sandwich on fresh French bread. One of the best sandwiches I have had and it was only $5.99. I would crawl through 10 miles of broken glass to go back there. It is THAT good. Just go and you will see for yourself.

rxmBnAEiLKw0Esw3AB9rHg.text: The best bakery I've ever been to! Highly Recommend the Almond Croissant, Ham & Cheese croissant (have them warm it up!) and any of the Tarts!

5AdSJqeunwpxkL8opidpdQ.text: It's wonderful that such a nice bakery has opened in the South Hills, but until they figure out how to manage their popularity, I won't be a fan.  I've gone three times in the two weeks they've opened.  The first time I went at about 11:30 for just a baguette and I waited in line 10 minutes, behind only two people.  The next time I stopped in for a baguette about 2pm and they had none left, so I left, too. (Seriously - a french bakery should NEVER run out of baguettes.)  The straw that broke the camel's back was arriving this past Sunday at 9:30 a.m.  The line was out the door - kudos to them for their popularity - but it took 40 minutes to get served! And all I wanted was a baguette and two croissants.  They need to figure out a better system, like more staff or two registers.   If I ever see more than two cars in the parking lot, I will head straight to Giant Eagle for my bread instead.

XYoBpv9rKvIX_49RrSuRPA.text: I was pleasently surprised when I found out that one of the best bakeries in the city (according to Yelp)opened up a south hills location. My first visit was late in the day on a Saturday. Unfortunately, almost everything was sold out. I ended up with a chocolate croissant. It was flaky and delicious but I was not blown away. I wondered what all the hype was about. My second encounter with LG was during a party I attended. LG supplied the desserts in the form of bite size portions of their popular treats including (my fav) the chocolate eclair. Ok. Now I'm starting to get it. Those were three delicious bites. My next encounter was earlier in the day on a Saturday. I opted for the cherry bread pudding. OMG. Yep. I'm converted. It was so incredible. Hubs wanted a taste but there was no way I was going to share. Overall, forget about the calories and just go! My only gripe is that all of the portions are huge! I'd love to be able to stop in and get several small croissants or other treats.

Eq7yJfCJLhMWwSPbEwVYUw.text: Love this place as much as the original.  Literally everything is delicious.  Love to stop by and pick up a coffee and croissant.  My husband loves their lemon tart and opera bars.  The place can be packed on Saturday and Sunday mornings, so a pre-office drive-by during the week is a good plan.  (Parking can be an issue...)

lrsMOoKOrhP7h1VEAzUIyA.text: My opera wasn't rich and sweet at all. I just wasted 3.75.

IC_35OI6c0sUkbFIyd0Sdw.text: Having been eagerly awaiting the opening of this bakery in Mt Lebanon, I decided to meet a friend here for coffee/breakfast. The pastries are wonderful, and very authentically French. However, the decor is really low budget, certainly not very French- more like a Subway shop- and lacked any sort of old world Parisian charm. No French music here, no rustic wood floors- cheap linoleum tile floors like you'd see in your kids school restroom. and no French decor that i could see. There are only 3-4 small tables and chairs, and again, not French feeling at all. I was really disappointed in the ambiance, as they gutted the place to make this bakery and this is the decor they came up with?? Not very cozy or inviting. No specialty coffees available either. Was hoping for a cafe au lait to enjoy with my quiche - no such luck. Would i recommend? Yes for the pastries, no for a Parisian escape in the South Hills of Pittsburgh.  And the parking is very limited.

cwrnm9DukThc1t66bWbTFQ.text: I had been wanting to try this place forever.  With this many five star reviews, I knew I was in for a treat, but I am never over in Lawrenceville.  When I happened to drive by this location, I knew I had to stop.  I planned on getting just one or two sweet treats.  Impossible!  Their case looks amazing, the bread smells amazing, everything is just so tantalizing, that I ended up with 4!  From recommendations of some nice gentlemen savoring their treats, I got an individual-sized lemon torte, some cookie thing with pistachio cream and fresh strawberries, a chocolate croissant and a brie-sour cream torte.  To say that they were outstanding would be an understatement.  The brie torte was likely my favorite as I am a savory kind of girl.  It was brie and sour cream mixed with pepper and spices in the middle of the flakiest crust I have ever had in my life bread.  Absolutely delicious!  Don't waste your time wondering if this is as good as you hear or just dream about going there.  Go.  Go now.  And bring something back for me!

kqoozJDB95bd6UFXYHpPCA.text: This place is a real gem in our town. I stopped here at least once a week for pastries my favorite is the croissant Almond. I have never enjoyed better French pastry. Their desserts are also spectacular. You will not regret ordering soup and a sandwich here.

photos.caption: Photo of La Gourmandine Bakery & Pastry Shop - Mt Lebanon, PA, United States. There a little cakes all works of art.
Photo of La Gourmandine Bakery & Pastry Shop - Mt Lebanon, PA, United States. Eclair chocolat

D0DCxj-gpjB37c35XceA8Q.text: We've been regulars since it opened. We have tried almost everything, and we've never been disappointed. Their baguette is the only type of bread we'll have for breakfast, and their pastries are the only quality ones you can get in the South Hills. Their sandwiches and quiches are also amazing, and always fresh. What can I say? La Gourmandine is the best!

tpJmFFMPNup1lwufPbI8eA.text: I came home sick from a vacation, and all I immediately wanted were these pastries.  Abricotine is fantastic in the morning with coffee, the pan aux chocolat is to die for heated up with all that melting chocolate, there's an apple pastry that is like the abricotine that I can't remember the name of, but is equally delicious, and finally, the choux a la creme -- oh my god.  You'll never leave disappointed.  Everything is fresh, and mouth watering.  I had to stop myself from going in AGAIN today...

fF_AyRhzdjTI7kzFeEX1sg.text: The best almond croissant; I crave them!! Everything else is also fresh and delicious, wonderful place!

ClVlIB2_V9Rz-TMzuVW8JQ.text: Delicious, authentic French desserts. Eating their desserts make me feel as if I'm in Paris again. The macarons are to die for. Truly delicious - we will be back time and time again.

6qrV-gjTOg-gqA4clNATTQ.text: what can i say that hasn't been said already?  the almond croissants are so delicious i dream of them. honestly, everything i've gotten here has been so delicate and delicious - everything you'd expect from a french patisserie.  so glad they opened this 2nd location closer to home - love this place!!

photos.caption: Photo of La Gourmandine Bakery & Pastry Shop - Mt Lebanon, PA, United States. A sampling of their sweet treats for a friend&#39;s bday - so good!!

g-YLi9F9TwiQXo-9vCl51Q.text: My son and I have visited this location on several occasions, and are quite pleased with the taste of the baked goods and the attentative service.    I commend the owners and the staff for maintaining quality products and providing outstanding service.  I visited another French bakery in the Pittsburgh area, and regrettably it did not meet the same quality and service standards.

rgljGaMMmDrVT8u04TvAJg.text: This place. I can't even... It is just incredible. AND now a second location!!! The best french pastries I've ever had. Wait. The best pastries I've ever had! And the most artful too!  Walking in you're met with the most amazing smell you've ever experienced in your life. Then you gaze across the display of beautiful creations, you almost don't wait to eat them. But you do. And you enjoy them, immensely. There really isn't a pasty I've had that I didn't like. The almond croissants are my fave's, but I also enjoy their pistachio desserts and chocolate wafer-like desserts. Forgive me for not remembering their proper name. I think I was too busy shoving them in my mouth.  This location is a lot bigger than their orginal one, plus the free parking lot is a major perk compared to the Lawrenceville street parking. Plus, there's free wifi! I think it would be dangerous to sit here for a while...

XPITHs9NKipTH4NNrRKtkw.text: Outstanding. Very clean interior. Presentations are very important here. The baked goods are identical and perfect every day and all day. Nothing sloppy. Amazing quality control. I've liked everything I have tried. Takeout items are packed with care and not thrown in a bag. I usually get one of the baked pastries and a coffee and eat at one of the little tables inside. I haven't tried the bread yet but I intend to. I would not hesitate to order a cake for the next special occasion.  Sometimes the staff don't always seem engaging. It's hard to see their faces through the tall display case perhaps.  You definitely need to know French as all the descriptions are in French. It makes it difficult to order or to know what the ingredients are. You usually have to ask or guess.

photos.caption: Photo of La Gourmandine Bakery & Pastry Shop - Mt Lebanon, PA, United States
Photo of La Gourmandine Bakery & Pastry Shop - Mt Lebanon, PA, United States
Photo of La Gourmandine Bakery & Pastry Shop - Mt Lebanon, PA, United States

lB579mxXZIuSuuoEbKqV7A.text: Nice bakery. However I asked for my pizza to be hot and it was cold after they heated it up. It wasn't very good. The deserts are great. Too many people sit and talk and hit up the tables who were done eating, leaving me to eat in my car.

ekg0yGbhG9J5pGrsk9pDoQ.text: My family purchased some pastries.  And, my husband wanted some additional croissants , but the lady with the dark hair, who i believe is part owner of the business, was coughing and coughing everywhere! She barely  covered her mouth, and was standing right over the uncovered pastries!  My husband changed his mind pretty quick. Thank goodness the other stuff was already in bagged and she didn't wait on us! This was the last week of  December 2017.  Considering you work in a food business, and if you have a cough that bad, you shouldn't be around food!  Very disappointed! This was the Mt. Lebanon location.

HdSZhX5CAtoKXTU82YoWcQ.text: A beautiful European style bakery.  The presentation of the many delicacies is exquisite and the taste is even better!!  Had a wonderful chocolate eclair with a chocolate custard filling.  The apple pastry, croissants are all top notch.  Friendly, helpful staff.  This bakery is a True gem.  It is certainly worth a visit.   Highly recommend!!

photos.caption: Photo of La Gourmandine Bakery & Pastry Shop - Mt Lebanon, PA, United States. Yum

TJ5CGN-UngMAJQvWuj_izw.text: I stopped in around 1pm on a Friday afternoon. Parking was not bad at this time. The people there were friendly and the baked goods were amazing even after sitting in my car for 3 hours.

PBPKpZ_AddDIBsDFkk368g.text: My nephew and I headed to La Gourmandine in Mt. Lebo to pick up some treats and he thoroughly enjoyed the chocolate eclair while I indulged in the pistachio eclair.  Bought home some chocolate cakes and raspberry jelly cookies which quickly disappeared.  Adults and kids can enjoy these treats!

tf1ozPLhr3y72DzXYMH5wA.text: Excellent bread and pastries-- very authentic, which makes sense since the owners are "authentically" born, raised, and trained. :)   Everything about this place is great except for one thing-- I wish that they served real espresso and got rid of the Keurig-style machine behind the counter.

fAN-_rvEU3FqrYPUTAKotg.text: My wife was so excited when this location opened. We stop in regularly after the kids are off to school. We have yet to find anything that isn't fantastic.   Not only are the pastries great, but it's a great place to stop for lunch.

nI7SyVbOyqZR7llfiW3wtg.text: Almond croissant.  You don't need to know anything else.  Just do It.  (end of review)  Just kidding (but not really).  When I found out La Gourmandine was coming to Mount Lebanon, to say I was stoked is an understatement.  Many times I had visited the Lawrenceville location later in the day only to find my favorite treat out of stock.  Now that they're in our back yard, it's more than easy to run for a morning pastry and a coffee (probably not a good thing for my wallet nor my waist).  Honestly, everything here is solid (and from what I've heard from a few French friends, truly representative of a French pastry shop).  A word of warning...  this place gets busy during the weekend mornings and you can easily drop a small fortune on baked goods if you don't exhibit self-control.  Try stopping by on a weekday morning if you can, grab a coffee and enjoy one of their pastries warmed up...  doesn't get any better than that in the South Hills!

C5vtYMnh8FnzI1EtAaT8OA.text: The pastries....amazing. I stopped in and ordered an assortment for work, and they were all delicious. The inside is small and there was a line, but the pace was fast, so know what you want before you go in, or step back. Everything was beautifully presented and labeled.  The back of the bakery is lined with beautiful artisan breads. My favorite was the almond croissant and the pistachio eclair.  I would go broke if I were left to my own device in this shop.  It is pricey, but you get what you pay for, and you leave with great quality products.  I will definitely be returning, I have desserts I left behind and breads I would like to try.   What a gem to the area!

D3HuuOI3OTMAapMJfdaU3Q.text: I learned of La Gourmandine last Friday, and have been in 5 times since then (and it's only been 7 days!!).  I was introduced to them through indulging in the Raspberry Torte, and have since had the croissants (coco-almond and chocolate), the baguettes, the turkey swiss sandwich, the chocolate eclair and the fruit filled macaron.  All of them were amazing but I'll be back for more raspberry tartlettes, the sandwich and the croissants.  My daughter loved the macaron - she will be asking about more of those for days to come.    Fortunately/Unfortunately, I see myself popping in here weekly in the future, and I will have a hard time holding back from coming in daily... if it becomes more than an occasional thing, I will need to get more spin classes in!!

16KVwggbjCWhow8HeJ-ZNA.text: Fantastic French bakery! The pastries are delicious and not too sweet-just as they are meant to be. Their prices are incredibly reasonable, service is fast and friendly, and the food is really great! The coffee situation could be improved, but it's worth overlooking for the tasty treats!

yzrW-aqwn7mnX_aruywO2Q.text: The best bakery in Pittsburgh, French or otherwise!  Excellent customer service and excellent product.  I have not had anything from any of their bakeries that wasn't top notch.

EQ9topdJ8QL9W0nYe3Ookw.text: What can I say... fabulous pastries and bread, and all fresh-baked and delicious. Some of my favorites are the Croissant Auux Amades (filled with almond cream and toasted almonds) and the Abricotine (filled with pastry cream and topped with apricots).  Makes me hungry just typing about them. The custom cakes are masterpieces of taste and looks, though a bit pricier than a Giant Eagle cake....but well worth it for those special birthdays and occasions.

eJsQCvgTRK4Ztt-djawfxA.text: This is my favorite place in Pittsburgh- not just favorite bakery- favorite place period! It feels like you walked into a small French town every time you go there. And the smells are as incredible as the sweet and savory treats inside. Even my dog gets excited when I go there, because I treat her to a little bite of baguette. The finely crafted desserts and pastries are what they're famous for, but their sandwiches are incredible. And, of course, they have great quiche. They even feature locally brewed coffee. You can dine in at sweet little tables and they have books and such for the kiddos. A can't miss!

FYNNeSW8oQZIyY_rEWxR_g.text: My favorite place in the world!!! Where do I begin- Ive been there about 50 times in the past year! I love everything! My favorite sandwiches are the turkey and cheese and the ham and chz. The best pastries are the almond crossiant and bostock. As for desserts, the merquise is absolutely amazing!!! Its all worth It! I've also gotten many birthday cakes from here

dzjVwcoicU58JCdF7GT1iw.text: The lady who is helping me to pick out of croissants section is very rude, it was first time there I just wanted to try many of them buying each of them. We just started croissants part the one that I wanted name couldn't pronounced correctly by me and pointed it with fingers which has tall glass divider no chance to touch it and as an educated adult I know very well not to touch them!!!!!!!!!! She just warned me rigorously by saying do not get your finger over them.  The customer always deserves nice attitude and politeness!!!

bSe4sM2rBPSuHSWsSNCjoQ.text: Loved this little spot. Fresh baked pastries, cookies, and bread. I tried the Brie tart and it was delicious. I also had a double espresso which wasn't made the traditional way it was also really good.   It's a good place to stop and grab something to go. There wasn't enough room to be able to sit and enjoy as a large group had taken all the tables and pushed them together. But I will do sure be back to try more!

VZzo0vnXSEjsQvLgz3jc4w.text: La Gourmandine is amazing!! I'm not sure that I've ever eaten at any other French bakery but I can't imagine another bakery being better than La Gourmandine. I've never had a bad thing there, not even something that was just so so. Everything is just perfect!  Whether you want something sweet or savory they will have just the thing for you. My favorite is their almond croissant. And also the quiche. The best quiche I've ever eaten.  The location in Lawrenceville is just as good as Mt. Lebanon. There's no difference in the quality or what they serve.  Get over to La Gourmandine ASAP! You'll be hooked!!

photos.caption: Photo of La Gourmandine Bakery & Pastry Shop - Mt Lebanon, PA, United States. Olive bread
Photo of La Gourmandine Bakery & Pastry Shop - Mt Lebanon, PA, United States. More pastries!
Photo of La Gourmandine Bakery & Pastry Shop - Mt Lebanon, PA, United States. Pastries galore!

WNTpqOjpXm4OHAofgcUv9Q.text: My husband and I make a point to stop in here every Saturday morning or afternoon. Its such a treat to have La Gourmandine on a weekly basis but we can't help ourselves. There's nothing that I've had from La Gourmandine that I haven't liked. Almond croissants, chocolate croissants, apricot pastries, and even sandwiches. Everything is flaky, buttery, and absolutely perfect. I absolutely love that the dessert pastries are sweet, but not overwhelmingly sweet.   My only complaint is that you kind of have to know what you want when coming in. The workers try to be efficient and get everyone out the door as soon as possible, so that could be a lot of pressure when you're just in awe of all the beautiful options. However, you really could just point randomly at anything in the display case and it be good. You also can't go wrong with any of the items I listed above if you want to go in prepared to spitfire your order. But one bite of a pastry and you can forget all about being rushed to order.   I will be here again and again and I recommend you do the same! So worth it!

lvgvq6rZbFCR7dP-LmhMSQ.text: BEST MACARONS IN PITTSBURGH!!! They have a variety of flavors, but they also have these massive macarons with fruit in them... so good! I absolutely love macarons and, until I found this place, I didn't have a good place to get them in Pittsburgh. Definitely give this place a try! They're a French bakery, so they also have really good croissants, breads, etc!

SfY5Y7t_UagRgNFFB_jkCw.text: I like this location better than the other ones because there is more options and it is not always sold out. And it is pretty clean and there are places to sit.

8Wg7KJiay8CV1ANQu-AshQ.text: I've been here a few times and I really like it. The almond croissants are fantastic. I haven't had the opportunity to try out their lunch options yet but I've heard from others that it's also great. Service has always been good. I love that they're open on Mondays, because most bakeries aren't. Parking is tough. The last time I've been there weren't any spots open and we had to park in the lot for the insurance office next door.

Y8Y40IeH5jIf50NNf39Zgg.text: Paris! What can I say? I was thrilled that this French inspired bakery opened a second location in Mt Lebanon. They have their own parking but the lot is very small and of course filled. Across the street is an abandoned gas station where I would imagine you can park if need be.  Stopped here for lunch with my daughter. I ordered the goat cheese and spinach quiche while she settled for a ham and cheese on a French baguette. They advised me for dessert to get the almond danish which is filled with almond creme. It must have been very popular since I got the last one! I noticed later on they restocked them.  That sandwich of her's was so huge I thought there was no way she could finish it but she did. My quiche was heated and brought out to me. It was okay. I'm not used to goat cheese but it wasn't overly filling so I could enjoy my danish. That almond danish was very flaky and literally came apart on me as I ate it. It was delicious!  She had some sort of chocolate bar dessert which she let me sample. It was very rich and quite filling had I ordered it.  They only have a few tables if you wish to eat in. Take out is available and of course you can call if you want to preorder baked goods or their breads.   The staff was very friendly and helpful. If you eat inside then your food is served on actual dishes and they will let you box up leftovers to take home. As we were leaving I purchased a fruit filled macaroon cookie for my daughter and a chocolate chip style danish for a friend. I was told that danishes will only last a day but does not need refrigeration while anything in their refrigerated case should be placed in the refrigerator once you get home.  This place is easy to miss since it sits near the corner of Cochran and Cedar roads. Still it made for a nice mid day treat for both of us. My advice would be to get there early for best selection. Will definitely visit it again sometime in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of La Gourmandine Bakery & Pastry Shop - Mt Lebanon, PA, United States. Layers of custard and butter cream with fruit
Photo of La Gourmandine Bakery & Pastry Shop - Mt Lebanon, PA, United States. Lemon tart
Photo of La Gourmandine Bakery & Pastry Shop - Mt Lebanon, PA, United States. Croissant with swiss cheese and special sauce

wHDiKpcWHx0GRCr-0EhwdQ.text: An extraordinary little way to treat yourself. Flavorful and satisfying treats bring me back to my childhood as a bakers family.

lAooQX4-7o1vGH7Pbfi3_Q.text: Very disappointed. Called on a Thursday morning to inquire about quiche for Mother's Day. I was informed by the employee on the phone they have 2 available for purchase in the store and 3 special quiche's for order. I decided to stop in to place my order. I went in about 10am Thursday to place my order for Sunday and I was informed they were no longer taking orders for Mother's Day. Seriously???  I just spoke with you on the phone!

tkCMxO02vACwdtSo2tyhEg.text: I must admit I am a complete fan of Jean-Marc Chatellier's French Bakery in Millvale, but I gave La Gourmandine a try and they come a close second.  There was a line on Saturday morning even before the doors opened, and I think a line is a common occurrence. The almond croissants are quite excellent, plus I bought a classic lemon tart (Citron).   I'm holding out for Jean-Marc's in terms of prices and quality, however La Gourmandine will do if I can't get to Millvale.

photos.caption: Photo of La Gourmandine Bakery & Pastry Shop - Mt Lebanon, PA, United States
Photo of La Gourmandine Bakery & Pastry Shop - Mt Lebanon, PA, United States
Photo of La Gourmandine Bakery & Pastry Shop - Mt Lebanon, PA, United States

qN0wTasLTLvoTJHLfJSWJA.text: We love this place. The food is delicious, and the prices are *very* reasonable. Everything, has great flavor: bread, croissants, sandwiches, cookies, pastries. It's not as fancy as Gaby et Jules in Squirrel Hill, and that's a good thing. This place feels like a neighborhood bakery that you can (and we do) stop at frequently, not an occasional indulgence. I love their sandwiches, the bread makes such a difference, and they're less than $6! They usually only have 4 kinds of macarons, but I think they're only $1.75 and they're better and cheaper than what you get at whole foods or various cafes in town. Their pistachio pastry cream is absolutely amazing - there's always a pistachio macaron and 1-3 other pastries that use it.   Wishlist? I do wish they had some whole grain/seedy bread - but maybe that's a German/Scandinavian thing. Also, drinks are pretty limited, orangina or carbonated water would be a nice addition to their lunches.

OMzYN3_7H6TXE1q08yZQyA.text: I cannot say enough about how delicious the pastries are at La Gourmandine.  I've tried the almond, regular & chocolate croissants.  The almond is my fave, the taste is unexplainable!  The tarts were also very delectable.  The only thing to know is that they use almond flour here.  My boyfriend has a nut allergy, but he's been fine eating the things with no added nuts.  The line can be long sometimes but the service is quick and friendly.  When the line's long, then it must be worth the wait.  It's also a little pricier than your average bakery, but you're getting quality.....not just a donut!

reck73PC8OxcKEql5p7oLQ.text: Let me preface this by saying I'm not a big fan of sweets. With that being said, I stopped in today to purchase a single baguette. My wife is a big fan of all sweet baked goods, so I requested "a few sweets for my wife." The woman was very nice and pleasant, and recommend a chocolate dish of some sorts and a lemon tart. Though I usually avoid sweets altogether, I decided to try some of the lemon tart. It was quite possibly the best dessert I've ever had. It's changed my entire outlook on desserts.

hLcRJ2SHC2jyqNQ4mJCnpQ.text: This place is consistently great! We always go here to pick up some pastries for  visiting guests. The almond croissants and l gourmond (chocolate and pastry creme pastries) are always excellent. Staff is friendly and helpful, the quality is always above average and prices are quite reasonable. Nice selection of breads and deserts too.

JlYHhD4gsM0y1-JI4uWCFQ.text: My daughter wants to do a high tea, nothing here We found this cute French pastry  Delicious! They got parking space!  Reasonable price Just delicious  Worth the drive

photos.caption: Photo of La Gourmandine Bakery & Pastry Shop - Mt Lebanon, PA, United States. Yummy!

mQWh7867RH-WVVG7SGz21A.text: Literally the absolutely worst bakery I have encountered. I know it's a multi-site commercial bakery where the managers are paid to run a profit margin and not have a vision, but they dont even try.  1: my order was much worse tha. Had I just picked it up at giant eagle.  2: the people in front of me ordered a cake and were disappointed, the manager treated them like crap and told them the cake was never listed on the website * I was looking at the website .  Terrible place, worse staff.  A place for white people that like to spend money on a bad product.

SoNEaRVz36gtIoiih4DNrw.text: I will say this if I lived in the area this would be very dangerous.. why because everything is FABULOUS. They have three locations and we came to this (the Mt. Lebanon) location since it was near family we were visiting. It's not a very big place, there are a few tables, you can get your coffee and treats and stay but to be honest I'd get your things to go. It's a busy place and EVERYONE is ordering everything and a lot of it. If you have no clue or your French is rusty the staff is helpful in giving you information. I believe I spoke to  owner maybe and used my very bad French but I was proud of myself that I spoke to her. The croissants are to die for.. the only ones better are in Paris or a small place in Chicago called Vanille' Patisserie or in Montreal. No place where I currently live in Rochester, NY can compare. The Pain du Chocolate is excellent as well as the Almond croissants. The eclairs omg so luscious, the Paris  Brest, the Pommes  (apple tarts) omg as well as other treats. I'm still eating every bit of it...what I will say is the baguette is excellent but you best eat that the same day. They have macaroons, cakes, oh my... it's absolutely fabulous that the people of Pittsburgh have this most fabulous, decedent boulangerie (bakery). You must come, the prices are fair and for what I bought which was a lot considering was under $40. If you live in the area and come here sign u for the rewards program. They offered it to me but I stated we lived out of state. I know next time I'll sign up as I know we will be back to the area. They have a small parking lot and it's a small location be prepared to wait but it's worth it.. Hells yes I will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of La Gourmandine Bakery & Pastry Shop - Mt Lebanon, PA, United States. Bakery case
Photo of La Gourmandine Bakery & Pastry Shop - Mt Lebanon, PA, United States
Photo of La Gourmandine Bakery & Pastry Shop - Mt Lebanon, PA, United States. Outside

5JjP-vXO_JZBomOBt1_A-Q.text: Everything made and served here is fabulous and authentic. The service is friendly and professional. When inside, it feels like you've stepped outside of Mount Lebanon and into a tiny piece of France. I've been to the downtown Pittsburgh location but it lacks the charm of this location. Every time we get to experience La Gourmandine is a True treat!

4oCXdKLzwHLb81beyyHyqg.text: In the past, we loved coming here and trying different pastries. I've ordered cakes online and confirmed the order over the phone, no problem. I recently tried to place an order for my daughters birthday. I called to confirm and it was horrible. The woman taking the call neglected to place me on hold. I got to listen to the owner/boss yell at the woman and say awful things to her and about "the lady doesn't know what she's talking about & should've come in...lazy..." on the phone. She continued to insult me and complain about things not being on the website. (I was looking at the website when I called). I will not be returning to any location.

AtVkR_t3rsMFKbsEG8y5mw.text: Excellent little French Bakery in the burbs. The wares are beautiful and the prices fair. I got an "abricotine" pastry for all of $1.90. If we lived in the area I would be a regular for sure. The picture is a good sampling of their wares.

photos.caption: Photo of La Gourmandine Bakery & Pastry Shop - Mt Lebanon, PA, United States

YM3iy-wjyV5lA6jSopOSmQ.text: Delicieux!! This place is like heaven for pastries! I absolutely love the variety and the quality of the goodies. Although I can't remember or pronounce most of the things there, I've tried almost every piece. My favorite one is the canelle which is similar to a cinnamon swirl. The sandwiches are also so good as the baguette is freshly baked and the flavors just blend so well. Don't forget the cakes! They are delicious! Do yourself a favor and stop by, guarantee that you will be returning!

auIAKSiQ2sY3qFs_HgUkqw.text: This bakery is amazing. I've only had the almond and chocolate croissants, and the bread -- they are fantastic and authentically French (based on my eating pastry all over Paris.) The only downsides are numerous pastry options that make it hard to decide, and the fact that they do not make real espresso or cappuccino. Wish I had one of their bakeries back home so I could go more often!

1md11FjAR3BuNcGDtCYuQw.text: Great bakery, pastry and sandwich shop. Freshly made food at Avery reasonable price.  Lovely place with small number of tables. Good coffee too.

VFC2NzjRt5PCKvd1FIuLTA.text: This place is adorable and everything I tried was amazing! Their macaroons are perfect and the other pastries I picked up were delicious too. I was surprised when the woman read my total because I expected it to be much higher based on the presentation of goods. Nice surprise! The women working here are funny and extremely friendly as well which will most certainly help bring me back. I can't wait to try more!! This is a hidden gem that I highly recommend!

x9YJaRvvi-OktKPe0kAGCg.text: I don't usually leave reviews but that Almond croissant made me do it. The best croissant I've ever had! I work across the street and all my office eat there everyday. Everything is fresh and delicious!

y5PGBptc527u49hcW0wNFg.text: I absolutely love La Gourmadine Bakery! I've been here several times, always on a Saturday morning. There is always a line of people waiting to get their favorites. Ive never been to any other locations. My favorites are the breakfast pastries including the abricotine and croissant aux amandes. I highly recommend both if you like breakfast pastries. The croissants are also deliciously flakey and buttery. Macaroons and torts are always amazing! I haven't had a thing I didn't like!   The interior is small but with a few tables to sit at if you want to eat your goodies there! Staff has always been nice but I do feel a little rushed sometimes when there is a line and they are trying to move you along. I don't recommend getting in line until you know what you want!

photos.caption: Photo of La Gourmandine Bakery & Pastry Shop - Mt Lebanon, PA, United States. Fruit macaron and fruit tart

NiLQijpd9GjubEAWPa9yug.text: I am a weekly patron here at this point. Sometimes twice weekly! I started with the Lawrenceville location and absolutely loved it - when I found out there was one closer to me, I was very excited.  My typical weekly buy is the Macaron aux Fruits - a large macaron filled with lychee cream and raspberries. It is DIVINE!   Other treats that I've tried:  Choux a la creme - this was great for a very light sweet treat. Airy pastry with a very light cream filling.   Delice de pistache - I was very excited to try this one as I normally love pistachio anything. I was not a big fan of the choux dough combined with the pistachio cream, but the cream itself was lovely.  Choquettes - these little guys are great for small treats. Tasty dough that is similar to a donut and dusted with sugar, and you get a dozen for $3!  Vegetarian quiche - I'm not well versed in the world of quiches but I was not a big fan of this. I think goat cheese is probably a love it or hate it thing, and I was not a fan of this. Would still like to try the other quiche with the bacon though!  Marquis - Rich, chocolatey, and definitely indulgent!  Mouelleux au chocolat - Very rich and very delicious! Kind of like a chocolate lava cake but far better than anything you'd get at Applebee's.   Fraisiers - delightful little sponge cakes, perfect for a sweet snack  Small macarons - So far, I've been 50/50 with the ones I've tried. I like the pink and purple ones.   Forget the name, but the pumpkin tart is easily the best tasting pumpkin dessert I've ever had.   Additionally, I'm not sure where they get their coffee, but it's very good. It never tastes burnt and is always fresh, and the flavor is wonderful.

JzaTfLgRwCfKYZ4x2gaA1Q.text: AMAZING! My favorite place in all of the neighborhood! Pastry, bread, sandwiches, quiche! It's all amazing. LOVE LOVE LOVE.

A15Uxcxk85QpeOtWB8OtpA.text: I am so disappointed. We just left. We got assorted pastries and macarons. They were absolutely beautifully looking, but were significantly lacking in flavor.   We visited another French bakery in Squirrel Hill a couple days ago and were craving more. Their macarons and chocolate croissants were life changing. We've been wanting more, but it's difficult to get to. We saw the good reviews on yelp and thought we'd give this place a try since we were passing by.   The macarons lacked flavor to the point of it being hard to distinguish what flavor each was.   The pastries seemed to either be over or under baked. None were just right. Some tasted eggy and had a rawish center while others left an unpleasant burnt taste in our mouths.   Next time we want French pastries, we will make the drive to squirrel hill instead.

photos.caption: Photo of La Gourmandine Bakery & Pastry Shop - Mt Lebanon, PA, United States
Photo of La Gourmandine Bakery & Pastry Shop - Mt Lebanon, PA, United States
Photo of La Gourmandine Bakery & Pastry Shop - Mt Lebanon, PA, United States

ljXaTBCtHqVcsuCnU5N4-A.text: La Gourmandine has my entire heart, Le Montagnard was amazing but i could barely finish half of it. The prosciutto with the butter was an amazing combination and the pickles added a burst of texture and flavor. I also got the lemon tart (le tarte au citron) and was anything but disappointed, the filling had the perfect amount of tart and sweetness to it, the meringue was fluffy and delicious, the crust had an odd texture but it was still great. I ordered the la gourmandise but i couldn't even get to it as i was too full from my other two items, my mom seemed to enjoy it though as she actually had to stop the car so she could eat it.

photos.caption: Photo of La Gourmandine Bakery & Pastry Shop - Mt Lebanon, PA, United States

HZRdJWHehNYKK57AOxSBJg.text: Stopped by to get some treats for Mother's Day.  Everything was excellent.  From the Frasier, macaron au fruit, to the almond croissant and even the pain de pie for sandwiches.  Tried the focaccia garnie that was scrumptious. Never disappointed in our selections.  If you come on a Saturday or Sunday morning there is usually a line but it doesn't take to long.  Surprised they don't have two cash registers on some of those days to move the line faster.

Y7WA3QOBmnACJVDNRDRJaw.text: Slightly on the pricier side so if you're in the mood to treat yourself to one of their homemade deserts or freshly baked breads this is the spot.

q2-GP98NfslPnR-kumDWvg.text: Pass this shop on my way home quite often so I have been wanting to try this place for a while! They do close pretty early so I was finally able to make it last week. La gourmadine did not disappoint. Their croissant was so flaky and buttery. The almond croissant did not look like a croissant but wow did it taste amazing. Every bite had flaky buttery almond goodness. The only thing I wasn't too impressed with was the spinach and goat cheese quiche. It was mediocre nothing special. The last thing I tried was the cream puff which was amazing. The cream was perfect not too thick or sweet and the pastry was perfect. Thank god I only bought one, I could have eaten four in one sitting.   Overall, a wonderful bakery in the south hills. Will definitely make an effort to return for their decadent pastries!

photos.caption: Photo of La Gourmandine Bakery & Pastry Shop - Mt Lebanon, PA, United States. Cute shop!
Photo of La Gourmandine Bakery & Pastry Shop - Mt Lebanon, PA, United States. Croissants are amazing!
Photo of La Gourmandine Bakery & Pastry Shop - Mt Lebanon, PA, United States. Tarts

Hw30jGS4sjGBCv7UDn-jpA.text: Excellent sandwiches bread pastries soup like going to a Paris bakery! The owner I believe is from France and relocated to Pittsburgh as a better oppty to start a new business than in Europe The staff is great you will enjoy  !
